info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 17 at 11:38PM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...SNOW... HAZARDS...A band of moderate snow accompanied by winds of up to 40 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than one mile. A quick dusting of snow is likely on untreated roadways, with locally icy conditions. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 1136 PM EST, an area of snow was along a line extending from Amenia to Scarsdale and moving southeast at 40 MPH. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Islip, Bridgeport, New Haven, Stamford, Waterbury, Norwalk, Danbury, Meriden, Brentwood, White Plains, Milford, Middletown, Wallingford, Shelton and Commack. SAFETY INFO... Icy roads are possible as the snow melts on the roadway and then quickly refreezes. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
